column2: NEVADA DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Drivers may pass on a two-lane roadway marked with a single solid yellow line on their side of the center line.
2. When a traffic signal light turns green, you should:
column8: wait 5 seconds before proceeding.
column10: yield the right-of-way to larger vehicles.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column8: Intersection ahead

column2: 4. To avoid the risk of being involved in an alcohol-related crash, you should:
column4: call a taxi if you've been drinking.
column6: say “No, thanks" if someone offers you alcohol.
column8: decide before you start drinking that you are not going to drive.

column2: 5. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.
column6: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.
column8: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.

column2: 6. Warning signs normally are:
column8: diamond-shaped.

column2: 7. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column8: Shift to a lower gear.
column10: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.

column2: 8. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column4: that a tire blowout is about to occur.
column8: of a steering failure.

column2: 9. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.
column6: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
column8: they approach a curve on a two-way road and can not see around it.

column2: 10. To avoid having to make an emergency stop while driving in traffic, drivers should:
column4: drive in the right lane only.
column6: sound their horn to warn other drivers.
column8: look ahead and maintain a safe following distance.
column10: drive slower than the flow of traffic.

column2: 11. Which of the following does NOT affect the distance that it takes to stop your vehicle?
column8: Braking distance.

column2: 12. At night, it is hardest to see:
column8: pedestrians.

column2: 13. When in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
column4: illegal to possess an open container of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column6: illegal to drink from, but permissible to transport, open containers of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column8: acceptable to drink alcoholic beverages if you are not driving.
column10: permissible to drink a moderate amount of alcohol when driving with a passenger.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column8: Four-lane highway ahead

column2: 15. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column4: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.
column8: Yes, but only if oncoming vehicles or bicycles are at least 10 feet away.

column2: 16. When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
column4: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.
column6: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.
column8: enter the right lane. When traffic permits, you can move out of the left lane.
column10: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.

column2: 17. A speed limit is the __________ speed at which a vehicle may legally travel on the road under ideal conditions.
column8: maximum

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column8: No Turning

column2: 19. At a light rail intersection, you should always:
column4: look both ways before crossing the tracks.
column6: share the road with pedestrians and bicyclists.
column8: be alert and obey all traffic signals.

column2: 20. Your blind spot is the area of the road:
column4: you see in your rearview mirror.
column6: you see in your side mirror.
column8: directly behind your vehicle.
column10: you cannot see without moving your head.

column2: 21. When driving in bad weather, drivers should:
column8: increase their speed to get to their destination more quickly.

column2: 22. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
column8: closetailing.

column2: 23. If another car has stopped in an adjacent lane in the same direction of travel, you should:
column4: tap your horn to let the other driver know you are passing.
column6: be careful in case the other vehicle has stopped for a pedestrian.
column8: pass the car on the left.
column10: speed up and pass the vehicle on the right.

column2: 24. Doing all you can to prevent crashes is called:
column8: ABS Driving

column2: 25. If driving in foggy weather, drivers should turn on their high-beams to increase the field of vision.
26. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column6: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.
column8: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.

column2: 27. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column4: Look through your back window for children.
column6: Get out of the car and check behind the car.
column8: Rely on your mirrors.

column2: 28. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
column8: darker

column2: 29. Two solid yellow lines on the pavement mean:
column6: passing is allowed for both drivers.
column8: passing is allowed if you are at the top of a hill.
column10: passing is allowed during daylight only.

column2: 30. If your car breaks down on the highway, you should:
column4: flash your headlights at oncoming traffic.
column8: use your four-way flashers to warn other drivers.
column10: sound your horn to warn passing vehicles.

column2: 31. This sign means:
column4: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column8: Roundabout ahead. Slow down.
column10: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.

column2: 32. If you stop at a railroad crossing with more than one track:
column4: go through when one of the tracks is free.
column6: wait until you have a clear view of both tracks.
column8: proceed with caution until you see a train.
column10: go through as soon as the first train passes.

column2: 33. This road sign means:
column8: Right lane closed
column10: No turns are allowed on this road

column2: 34. This sign indicates:
column8: Phone service ahead
column10: Do not use your phone while driving

column2: 35. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
column8: Turn off the ignition.

column2: 36. As you approach an intersection, the traffic light changes from green to yellow. You should:
column4: be prepared to stop before the intersection.
column6: speed up to beat the red light.
column8: apply the brakes sharply and come to a complete stop.
column10: be prepared to stop in the middle of the intersection.

column2: 37. This road sign means:
column8: Winding road ahead

column2: 38. This road sign means:
column6: You must come to a complete stop
column8: Slow down, stop if necessary and yield the right-of-way

column2: 39. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.
column6: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.
column8: the driver who was going faster before stopping must yield.
column10: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.

column2: 40. When driving at night, you should slow down and:
column4: use high beams whenever possible, but never when there's oncoming traffic.
column6: come to a complete stop whenever there's oncoming traffic.
column8: use high beams until other drivers dim their lights.
column10: follow the vehicle ahead more closely to avoid glare from oncoming headlights.

column2: 41. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you must park your car between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column6: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
column8: you are not allowed to park here.
column10: you must display a special permit in order to park here.

column2: 42. You may park or stop along the shoulder of the freeway:
column4: as long as you turn on your emergency flashers.
column6: if no part of your vehicle is on the road.
column8: only if you have an emergency.
column10: if you need to check your smartphone for directions.

column2: 43. When passing other vehicles, drivers should:
column4: pass the vehicle as slowly as possible.
column6: make sure the passing lane is clear of traffic, and check behind and to the left to make sure another vehicle is not attempting to pass.
column8: apply the brake and slow down.

column2: 44. If an aggressive driver is behind you:
column4: slow down and confront the aggressive driver.
column6: sound your horn and move to the left lane.
column8: increase you speed and flash your brake lights.
column10: try to get out of the aggressive driver’s way.

column2: 45. Which signs have black letters on a white background?
column8: Regulatory signs (vertical rectangle)

column2: 46. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: pass other vehicles and then stop.
column6: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.
column8: look both ways and be ready to stop.

column2: 47. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column4: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other vehicles.
column6: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.
column8: Leave the road immediately.
column10: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 48. This sign means:
column6: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.
column8: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.
column10: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.

column2: 49. A common mistake that drivers make is driving without adequate rest.
50. This road sign:
column6: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.
column8: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.
column10: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.
